baseline_groups.claim_summary: Thank-you calls increase donation probability (binary) among existing donors at public TV stations (Experiment 1).
baseline_groups.notes: Experiment 1 is the largest sample (N=462K). Baseline includes station x execution-date FE and full demographic controls. Paper finds null effect.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Thank-you calls increase conditional gift amount among existing donors at public TV stations (Experiment 1).
baseline_groups.notes: Conditional on donating. Same experiment as G1 but different outcome. Paper finds null effect.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Thank-you calls increase donation probability (binary) among existing donors at a national non-profit (Experiment 2).
baseline_groups.notes: Experiment 2 has no FE in baseline (no station x date groups). Fewer controls available (no demographics). Paper finds null effect.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Thank-you calls increase conditional gift amount among existing donors at a national non-profit (Experiment 2).
baseline_groups.notes: Conditional on donating. Same experiment as G3 but different outcome. Paper finds null effect.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Thank-you calls (new script) increase donation probability among existing donors at public TV stations (Experiment 3).
baseline_groups.notes: Experiment 3 uses a new call script. Paper finds null effect (p=0.134).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Thank-you calls (new script) increase conditional gift amount among existing donors at public TV stations (Experiment 3).
baseline_groups.notes: Conditional on donating. Same experiment as G5 but different outcome. Paper finds null effect.

global_notes: This paper reports null findings across all three experiments and both outcomes. The six baselines correspond to 3 experiments x 2 outcomes. Expected sign is marked unknown because the paper tests whether the effect is positive but ultimately finds null effects. All specifications use treat (thank-you call assignment) as treatment. Experiments 1 and 3 include station x execution-date FE; Experiment 2 has no FE. Heterogeneity and interaction specs are classified as non-core since they test conditional effects rather than the main average treatment effect.
